Module ‚Ä¢ Machine Learning Prediction

Unsupervised Clustering ‚Äî Bullet‚ÄëProof Streamlit App

Explore segments & anomalies with K‚ÄëMeans, Agglomerative, DBSCAN, and Gaussian Mixture ‚Äî built to avoid crashes and keep your session alive.

No labels required Unsupervised learning discovers structure in your data when you don‚Äôt have a target column. Typical outcomes: customer segments, device cohorts, behavior patterns, and anomaly candidates.

Algorithms (when to use)

  • K‚ÄëMeans ‚Äî compact, spherical clusters; fast; requires k.
  • Agglomerative ‚Äî hierarchical grouping; different linkage styles.
  • DBSCAN ‚Äî arbitrary shapes; flags noise (label = -1); no need to set k.
  • Gaussian Mixture ‚Äî soft clustering (probabilities); ellipsoidal shapes.

Quality metrics

  • Silhouette (‚Üë better separation)
  • Davies‚ÄìBouldin (‚Üì tighter clusters)
  • Calinski‚ÄìHarabasz (‚Üë well‚Äëdefined clusters)

The app computes metrics safely and skips invalid cases (e.g., single cluster or all noise).

Dataset

Use the sample bank operations dataset (daily visits + features):

bank_visits_complete_2024.csv

Pick multiple columns (numeric/categorical). If you include a date column, the app converts it to an ordinal feature automatically.

Outcome

Example Clustering Result (PCA scatter)

Colored points = discovered clusters; use this to sanity‚Äëcheck separation

A quick visual inspection helps validate cluster separation and spot outliers/noise before you act on segments.

1) Save as app.py

Stable, defensive Streamlit app (handles edge cases & keeps UI responsive)

# app.py
import os
import time
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import streamlit as st

# Try Plotly; fall back to Streamlit's built-in chart if not available
try:
    import plotly.express as px
    HAS_PLOTLY = True
except Exception:
    HAS_PLOTLY = False

from typing import List, Tuple

from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler, MinMaxScaler
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans, DBSCAN, AgglomerativeClustering
from sklearn.mixture import GaussianMixture
from sklearn.decomposition import PCA
from sklearn.metrics import silhouette_score, davies_bouldin_score, calinski_harabasz_score

st.set_page_config(page_title="Unsupervised Clustering", layout="wide")
DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR = r"C:\Users\sourc\OneDrive\Desktop\Python\Erbil Air Polution"

# ----------------- Session State (no auto-blank after click) -----------------
if "run_clicked" not in st.session_state:
    st.session_state.run_clicked = False
if "df_cache" not in st.session_state:
    st.session_state.df_cache = None

# ------------------------------- Utilities -----------------------------------
def safe_read_csv(file_or_path) -> pd.DataFrame:
    df = pd.read_csv(file_or_path)
    return df

def coerce_selected_features(df: pd.DataFrame, selected: List[str]) -> Tuple[pd.DataFrame, List[str], List[str]]:
    """Convert 'date' to ordinal; attempt numeric coercion; split num vs cat."""
    df = df.copy()
    sel = selected.copy()

    if "date" in sel and "date" in df.columns:
        df["date"] = pd.to_datetime(df["date"], errors="coerce")
        df["date_ordinal"] = df["date"].map(lambda x: x.toordinal() if pd.notnull(x) else np.nan)
        sel = ["date_ordinal" if c == "date" else c for c in sel]

    # Try numeric conversion where possible (without breaking true categorical)
    for c in sel:
        if c in df.columns and df[c].dtype == "object":
            try:
                sample = df[c].dropna().astype(str).head(50)
                numeric_like = sample.str.match(r"^-?\d+(\.\d+)?$").mean() >= 0.7
            except Exception:
                numeric_like = False
            if numeric_like:
                df[c] = pd.to_numeric(df[c], errors="coerce")

    num_cols = df[sel].select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
    cat_cols = [c for c in sel if c not in num_cols]
    return df, num_cols, cat_cols

def make_preprocessor(num_cols, cat_cols, impute_strategy="median", scaler="StandardScaler"):
    num_steps = [("imputer", SimpleImputer(strategy=impute_strategy))]
    if scaler == "StandardScaler":
        num_steps.append(("scaler", StandardScaler()))
    elif scaler == "MinMaxScaler":
        num_steps.append(("scaler", MinMaxScaler()))

    num_pipe = Pipeline(steps=num_steps)
    cat_pipe = Pipeline(steps=[
        ("imputer", SimpleImputer(strategy="most_frequent")),
        ("onehot", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore"))
    ])

    pre = ColumnTransformer(
        transformers=[
            ("num", num_pipe, num_cols),
            ("cat", cat_pipe, cat_cols)
        ],
        remainder="drop",
        sparse_threshold=0.0  # force dense for PCA
    )
    return pre

def fit_cluster(X, algo, params, random_state=42):
    if algo == "KMeans":
        model = KMeans(n_clusters=int(params["n_clusters"]), n_init=10, random_state=random_state)
        labels = model.fit_predict(X)
    elif algo == "Agglomerative":
        n_clusters = int(params["n_clusters"])
        linkage = params["linkage"]
        try:
            model = AgglomerativeClustering(n_clusters=n_clusters, linkage=linkage, metric="euclidean")
        except TypeError:
            model = AgglomerativeClustering(n_clusters=n_clusters, linkage=linkage, affinity="euclidean")
        labels = model.fit_predict(X)
    elif algo == "DBSCAN":
        model = DBSCAN(eps=float(params["eps"]), min_samples=int(params["min_samples"]), metric="euclidean")
        labels = model.fit_predict(X)
    elif algo == "GaussianMixture":
        model = GaussianMixture(
            n_components=int(params["n_components"]),
            covariance_type=params["covariance_type"],
            random_state=random_state
        )
        model.fit(X)
        labels = model.predict(X)
    else:
        raise ValueError("Unknown algorithm")
    return model, labels

def compute_metrics(X, labels, algo_name):
    labels = np.asarray(labels)
    metrics = {}
    uniq = set(labels.tolist())
    if algo_name == "DBSCAN":
        core_labels = [l for l in uniq if l != -1]
        n_clusters = len(core_labels)
        metrics["n_clusters"] = n_clusters
        mask = labels != -1
        X_eval = X[mask]
        labels_eval = labels[mask]
    else:
        n_clusters = len(uniq)
        metrics["n_clusters"] = n_clusters
        X_eval, labels_eval = X, labels

    def safe_metric(func):
        try:
            if n_clusters >= 2 and len(np.unique(labels_eval)) >= 2 and len(labels_eval) >= 10:
                return float(func(X_eval, labels_eval))
            return None
        except Exception:
            return None

    metrics["silhouette"] = safe_metric(silhouette_score)
    metrics["davies_bouldin"] = safe_metric(davies_bouldin_score)
    metrics["calinski_harabasz"] = safe_metric(calinski_harabasz_score)
    return metrics

def pca_embedding(X, dims=2, random_state=42):
    n_features = X.shape[1]
    n_comp = min(dims, n_features if n_features > 0 else 1)
    pca = PCA(n_components=n_comp, random_state=random_state)
    emb = pca.fit_transform(X)
    cols = ["x","y"] if n_comp == 2 else ["x","y","z"][:n_comp]
    return pd.DataFrame(emb, columns=cols)

def cluster_profiles(df: pd.DataFrame, labels, sel_cols, num_cols, cat_cols):
    out = df.copy()
    out["cluster"] = labels
    grp = out.groupby("cluster", dropna=False)
    num_means = grp[num_cols].mean(numeric_only=True).round(3) if num_cols else pd.DataFrame()

    top_cats = []
    for c in cat_cols:
        try:
            mode_series = grp[c].agg(lambda s: s.mode().iloc[0] if s.dropna().size else np.nan)
            top_cats.append(mode_series.rename(c))
        except Exception:
            pass
    top_cats = pd.concat(top_cats, axis=1) if top_cats else pd.DataFrame()
    sizes = out["cluster"].value_counts(dropna=False).rename_axis("cluster").reset_index(name="count")
    return out, sizes, num_means, top_cats

# -------------------------------- UI: Load Data --------------------------------
st.title("üè¶ Unsupervised Clustering (Multiple Columns) ‚Äî Stable Build")

st.sidebar.header("1) Load Data")
uploaded = st.sidebar.file_uploader("Upload CSV", type=["csv"], help="Or use the file path below.")
default_path = os.path.join(DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR, "bank_visits_complete_2024.csv")
path_text = st.sidebar.text_input("CSV file path", value=default_path)
load_clicked = st.sidebar.button("Load")

df = st.session_state.df_cache
load_msg = st.empty()

if load_clicked or (df is None and os.path.exists(path_text)):
    try:
        if uploaded is not None:
            df = safe_read_csv(uploaded)
        else:
            df = safe_read_csv(path_text)
        st.session_state.df_cache = df
        load_msg.success(f"Loaded data: {df.shape[0]} rows √ó {df.shape[1]} columns")
    except Exception as e:
        load_msg.error(f"Failed to load CSV: {e}")
        df = None

if df is None:
    st.info("üìÑ Upload a CSV or enter a valid file path, then click **Load**.")
else:
    st.subheader("Preview")
    st.dataframe(df.head(20), use_container_width=True)

# ------------------------------ Feature Selection ------------------------------
if df is not None:
    st.sidebar.header("2) Select Features")
    all_cols = df.columns.tolist()
    recommended = [
        "is_weekend","is_holiday","branch_open_hours","staff_on_duty","is_payday",
        "marketing_campaign","promo_strength","atm_outage","temp_c","rain_mm","aqi","dust_event",
        "total_visit","teller_visits","atm_visits","service_visits","transactions_total",
        "avg_wait_time_min","new_accounts_opened","loan_inquiries","complaints",
        "cash_deposits","cash_withdrawals","fx_transactions"
    ]
    default_sel = [c for c in recommended if c in all_cols] or df.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
    selected = st.sidebar.multiselect("Columns to use", options=all_cols, default=default_sel)

    st.sidebar.header("3) Preprocessing")
    impute_strategy = st.sidebar.selectbox("Numeric imputation", ["median","mean"], index=0)
    scaler_choice = st.sidebar.selectbox("Scaling", ["StandardScaler","MinMaxScaler","None"], index=0)

    st.sidebar.header("4) Algorithm")
    algo = st.sidebar.selectbox("Method", ["KMeans","Agglomerative","DBSCAN","GaussianMixture"], index=0)

    params = {}
    if algo in ("KMeans","Agglomerative"):
        params["n_clusters"] = st.sidebar.slider("n_clusters", 2, 20, 5, 1)
        if algo == "Agglomerative":
            params["linkage"] = st.sidebar.selectbox("linkage", ["ward","complete","average","single"], index=0)
    elif algo == "DBSCAN":
        params["eps"] = st.sidebar.slider("eps", 0.1, 10.0, 1.5, 0.1)
        params["min_samples"] = st.sidebar.slider("min_samples", 2, 50, 5, 1)
    elif algo == "GaussianMixture":
        params["n_components"] = st.sidebar.slider("n_components", 2, 20, 5, 1)
        params["covariance_type"] = st.sidebar.selectbox("covariance_type", ["full","diag","tied","spherical"], index=0)

    st.sidebar.header("5) Run")
    seed = st.sidebar.number_input("Random seed", min_value=0, value=42, step=1)
    if st.sidebar.button("Run Clustering"):
        st.session_state.run_clicked = True

    # ------------------------------- Run Block --------------------------------
    if st.session_state.run_clicked:
        if not selected:
            st.error("Please select at least one column.")
        else:
            try:
                with st.spinner("Running clustering..."):
                    df_proc, num_cols, cat_cols = coerce_selected_features(df, selected)
                    pre = make_preprocessor(num_cols, cat_cols, impute_strategy=impute_strategy, scaler=scaler_choice if scaler_choice!="None" else None)
                    X = pre.fit_transform(df_proc[num_cols + cat_cols])
                    model, labels = fit_cluster(X, algo, params, random_state=int(seed))
                    metrics = compute_metrics(X, labels, algo)
                    dims = 3 if HAS_PLOTLY else 2
                    try:
                        emb_df = pca_embedding(X, dims=dims, random_state=int(seed))
                    except Exception:
                        emb_df = pca_embedding(X, dims=2, random_state=int(seed))
                    df_labeled, sizes, num_means, top_cats = cluster_profiles(df_proc, labels, selected, num_cols, cat_cols)

                m1,m2,m3,m4 = st.columns(4)
                m1.metric("Clusters", metrics.get("n_clusters", None))
                m2.metric("Silhouette", f"{metrics['silhouette']:.3f}" if metrics.get("silhouette") is not None else "‚Äî")
                m3.metric("Davies‚ÄìBouldin ‚Üì", f"{metrics['davies_bouldin']:.3f}" if metrics.get("davies_bouldin") is not None else "‚Äî")
                m4.metric("Calinski‚ÄìHarabasz ‚Üë", f"{metrics['calinski_harabasz']:.1f}" if metrics.get("calinski_harabasz") is not None else "‚Äî")

                st.subheader("Cluster Sizes")
                st.dataframe(sizes, use_container_width=True)

                st.subheader("Visualization (PCA)")
                plot_df = emb_df.copy()
                plot_df["cluster"] = labels.astype(str)
                if HAS_PLOTLY and plot_df.shape[1]==3:
                    fig = px.scatter_3d(plot_df, x="x", y="y", z="z", color="cluster", opacity=0.85, title=f"{algo} Clusters (PCA 3D)")
                    st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
                elif HAS_PLOTLY:
                    fig = px.scatter(plot_df, x="x", y="y", color="cluster", opacity=0.9, title=f"{algo} Clusters (PCA 2D)")
                    st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
                else:
                    st.caption("Plotly not found. Showing basic 2D chart.")
                    st.scatter_chart(plot_df, x="x", y="y", color="cluster")

                st.subheader("Cluster Profiles")
                if not num_means.empty:
                    st.write("**Numeric means by cluster**")
                    st.dataframe(num_means, use_container_width=True)
                if not top_cats.empty:
                    st.write("**Top categorical values by cluster**")
                    st.dataframe(top_cats, use_container_width=True)

                st.subheader("Labeled Data (first 200 rows)")
                st.dataframe(df_labeled.assign(cluster=labels).head(200), use_container_width=True)

                st.subheader("Export")
                os.makedirs(DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR, exist_ok=True)
                default_out = os.path.join(DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR, f"clustered_{algo}_{int(time.time())}.csv")
                save_path = st.text_input("Save path", value=default_out, key="savepath_input")
                col_a, col_b = st.columns([0.4,0.6])
                with col_a:
                    if st.button("Save CSV to Disk"):
                        try:
                            df_labeled.assign(cluster=labels).to_csv(save_path, index=False, encoding="utf-8")
                            st.success(f"Saved: {save_path}")
                        except Exception as e:
                            st.error(f"Save failed: {e}")
                with col_b:
                    st.download_button(
                        "Download labeled CSV",
                        data=df_labeled.assign(cluster=labels).to_csv(index=False).encode("utf-8"),
                        file_name=os.path.basename(save_path),
                        mime="text/csv"
                    )

            except Exception as e:
                st.error(f"Clustering failed: {e}")

    if st.sidebar.button("Reset"):
        st.session_state.run_clicked = False
        st.experimental_rerun()

The app defaults to saving labeled files in: C:\Users\sourc\OneDrive\Desktop\Python\Erbil Air Polution. If you‚Äôre on macOS/Linux or Codespaces, change DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR near the top of app.py.

Reliability

Why this build doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúkick you out‚Äù

Defensive patterns throughout the pipeline

  • No st.stop() ‚Äî UI stays mounted after Run.
  • All heavy steps are wrapped in try/except with clear messages.
  • Automatic handling of date ‚Üí ordinal, numeric coercion for ‚Äúnumber‚Äëlike‚Äù strings, and robust missing‚Äëvalue imputation.
  • ColumnTransformer with One‚ÄëHot + scaling returns dense matrices (PCA‚Äësafe across versions).
  • Metrics computed only when valid (e.g., DBSCAN‚Äôs noise points excluded).
  • Optional Plotly; falls back to Streamlit chart if Plotly isn‚Äôt installed.
Data

What to feed the model?

Examples that cluster well

Bank operations (daily)

Visits, transactions, staffing, weather, promo flags, holidays.

Find traffic patterns, promotional lift cohorts, anomaly days.

Sensors & IoT

Pressure/temperature series, derived rates & rolling stats.

Detect device cohorts and early fault signatures.

Customer usage

Clicks, session lengths, features used, NPS, support contact.

Define product personas and tailor onboarding.

Text embeddings

Ticket titles or reviews encoded to vectors.

Find topic clusters and route intelligently.

Start with the provided dataset: bank_visits_complete_2024.csv.

    return pd.DataFrame(emb, columns=cols)

def cluster_profiles(df: pd.DataFrame, labels, sel_cols, num_cols, cat_cols):
    out = df.copy()
    out["cluster"] = labels
    grp = out.groupby("cluster", dropna=False)
    num_means = grp[num_cols].mean(numeric_only=True).round(3) if num_cols else pd.DataFrame()

    top_cats = []
    for c in cat_cols:
        try:
            mode_series = grp[c].agg(lambda s: s.mode().iloc[0] if s.dropna().size else np.nan)
            top_cats.append(mode_series.rename(c))
        except Exception:
            pass
    top_cats = pd.concat(top_cats, axis=1) if top_cats else pd.DataFrame()
    sizes = out["cluster"].value_counts(dropna=False).rename_axis("cluster").reset_index(name="count")
    return out, sizes, num_means, top_cats

# -------------------------------- UI: Load Data --------------------------------
st.title("üè¶ Unsupervised Clustering (Multiple Columns) ‚Äî Stable Build")

st.sidebar.header("1) Load Data")
uploaded = st.sidebar.file_uploader("Upload CSV", type=["csv"], help="Or use the file path below.")
default_path = os.path.join(DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR, "bank_visits_complete_2024.csv")
path_text = st.sidebar.text_input("CSV file path", value=default_path)

df = st.session_state.df_cache
load_msg = st.empty()

if load_clicked or (df is None and os.path.exists(path_text)):

        if uploaded is not None:
            df = safe_read_csv(uploaded)
        else:
            df = safe_read_csv(path_text)

        load_msg.success(f"Loaded data: {df.shape[0]} rows √ó {df.shape[1]} columns")
    except Exception as e:
        load_msg.error(f"Failed to load CSV: {e}")
        df = None

if df is None:
    st.info("üìÑ Upload a CSV or enter a valid file path, then click **Load**.")
else:
    st.subheader("Preview")
    st.dataframe(df.head(20), use_container_width=True)

# ------------------------------ Feature Selection ------------------------------
if df is not None:
    st.sidebar.header("2) Select Features")
    all_cols = df.columns.tolist()
    recommended = [
        "is_weekend","is_holiday","branch_open_hours","staff_on_duty","is_payday",

        "avg_wait_time_min","new_accounts_opened","loan_inquiries","complaints",
        "cash_deposits","cash_withdrawals","fx_transactions"
    ]
    default_sel = [c for c in recommended if c in all_cols] or df.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
    selected = st.sidebar.multiselect("Columns to use", options=all_cols, default=default_sel)

    st.sidebar.header("3) Preprocessing")
    impute_strategy = st.sidebar.selectbox("Numeric imputation", ["median","mean"], index=0)
    scaler_choice = st.sidebar.selectbox("Scaling", ["StandardScaler","MinMaxScaler","None"], index=0)

    st.sidebar.header("4) Algorithm")
    algo = st.sidebar.selectbox("Method", ["KMeans","Agglomerative","DBSCAN","GaussianMixture"], index=0)

    params = {}
    if algo in ("KMeans","Agglomerative"):
        params["n_clusters"] = st.sidebar.slider("n_clusters", 2, 20, 5, 1)
        if algo == "Agglomerative":
            params["linkage"] = st.sidebar.selectbox("linkage", ["ward","complete","average","single"], index=0)
    elif algo == "DBSCAN":
        params["eps"] = st.sidebar.slider("eps", 0.1, 10.0, 1.5, 0.1)
        params["min_samples"] = st.sidebar.slider("min_samples", 2, 50, 5, 1)
    elif algo == "GaussianMixture":
        params["n_components"] = st.sidebar.slider("n_components", 2, 20, 5, 1)
        params["covariance_type"] = st.sidebar.selectbox("covariance_type", ["full","diag","tied","spherical"], index=0)

    st.sidebar.header("5) Run")
    seed = st.sidebar.number_input("Random seed", min_value=0, value=42, step=1)
    if st.sidebar.button("Run Clustering"):
        st.session_state.run_clicked = True

    # ------------------------------- Run Block --------------------------------
    if st.session_state.run_clicked:
        if not selected:
            st.error("Please select at least one column.")
        else:
            try:
                with st.spinner("Running clustering..."):
                    df_proc, num_cols, cat_cols = coerce_selected_features(df, selected)
                    pre = make_preprocessor(num_cols, cat_cols, impute_strategy=impute_strategy, scaler=scaler_choice if scaler_choice!="None" else None)
                    X = pre.fit_transform(df_proc[num_cols + cat_cols])
                    model, labels = fit_cluster(X, algo, params, random_state=int(seed))
                    metrics = compute_metrics(X, labels, algo)
                    dims = 3 if HAS_PLOTLY else 2
                    try:
                        emb_df = pca_embedding(X, dims=dims, random_state=int(seed))
                    except Exception:
                        emb_df = pca_embedding(X, dims=2, random_state=int(seed))
                    df_labeled, sizes, num_means, top_cats = cluster_profiles(df_proc, labels, selected, num_cols, cat_cols)

                m1,m2,m3,m4 = st.columns(4)
                m1.metric("Clusters", metrics.get("n_clusters", None))
                m2.metric("Silhouette", f"{metrics['silhouette']:.3f}" if metrics.get("silhouette") is not None else "‚Äî")
                m3.metric("Davies‚ÄìBouldin ‚Üì", f"{metrics['davies_bouldin']:.3f}" if metrics.get("davies_bouldin") is not None else "‚Äî")
                m4.metric("Calinski‚ÄìHarabasz ‚Üë", f"{metrics['calinski_harabasz']:.1f}" if metrics.get("calinski_harabasz") is not None else "‚Äî")

                st.subheader("Cluster Sizes")
                st.dataframe(sizes, use_container_width=True)

                st.subheader("Visualization (PCA)")
                plot_df = emb_df.copy()
                plot_df["cluster"] = labels.astype(str)
                if HAS_PLOTLY and plot_df.shape[1]==3:
                    fig = px.scatter_3d(plot_df, x="x", y="y", z="z", color="cluster", opacity=0.85, title=f"{algo} Clusters (PCA 3D)")
                    st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
                elif HAS_PLOTLY:
                    fig = px.scatter(plot_df, x="x", y="y", color="cluster", opacity=0.9, title=f"{algo} Clusters (PCA 2D)")
                    st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
                else:
                    st.caption("Plotly not found. Showing basic 2D chart.")
                    st.scatter_chart(plot_df, x="x", y="y", color="cluster")

                st.subheader("Cluster Profiles")
                if not num_means.empty:
                    st.write("**Numeric means by cluster**")
                    st.dataframe(num_means, use_container_width=True)
                if not top_cats.empty:
                    st.write("**Top categorical values by cluster**")
                    st.dataframe(top_cats, use_container_width=True)

                st.subheader("Labeled Data (first 200 rows)")
                st.dataframe(df_labeled.assign(cluster=labels).head(200), use_container_width=True)

                st.subheader("Export")
                os.makedirs(DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR, exist_ok=True)
                default_out = os.path.join(DEFAULT_SAVE_DIR, f"clustered_{algo}_{int(time.time())}.csv")
                save_path = st.text_input("Save path", value=default_out, key="savepath_input")

                            st.success(f"Saved: {save_path}")
                        except Exception as e:

                with col_b:

            except Exception as e:

lessons.title: When to Use Unsupervised Machine Learning

content.body_md:
Module ‚Ä¢ Machine Learning

When to Use Unsupervised Machine Learning

Know the situations where clustering, anomaly detection, topic discovery, and dimensionality reduction add the most value.

Unsupervised ML is for learning structure from data without labels. Use it to discover groups, reduce dimensionality for visualization, or surface odd behavior that warrants action. It is often the first step before supervised models and a practical tool when labels are expensive, slow, or ambiguous.

Common families: Clustering Anomaly Detection Topic/Embeddings Dimensionality Reduction.

Use‚ÄëCases

Situations where unsupervised ML shines

Clear triggers that justify it, with examples from business and science

No labels, but you need structure

  • Segment customers by behavior (visits, products, channels).
  • Group wells/sensors by operating patterns.
  • Organize documents by topic without human tagging.

Labels are costly or slow

  • Expert labeling (geology cores, medical charts) is scarce.
  • Outcomes arrive months later (churn, repayments).
  • Use clusters to pre‚Äëlabel or prioritize review.

Anomaly or drift watch

  • Detect unusual device telemetry in real time.
  • Spot data pipeline drift before models degrade.
  • Find odd HR attendance patterns or fraud bursts.

High‚Äëdimensional ‚Üí human insight

  • Reduce hundreds of features to 2‚Äì3D plots (PCA/UMAP).
  • Explore embeddings of text/images for QA or search.
  • Share intuitive dashboards with non‚Äëtechnical teams.

Cold‚Äëstart or new markets

  • No labels in a new geography or product line.
  • Cluster to discover ‚Äúlook‚Äëalike‚Äù patterns quickly.

Pre‚Äëprocessing for supervised ML

  • Use cluster IDs or anomaly flags as features.
  • Balance datasets by sampling from clusters.
  • Compress correlated inputs to reduce noise.
Guide

Quick decision guide

Select a technique based on the question and data shape

Situation Technique Why Examples
Discover natural groups K‚ÄëMeans / GMM / Agglomerative Find compact or hierarchical structure Customer cohorts, geoscience facies, product bundles
Irregular shapes; noise matters DBSCAN / HDBSCAN Density‚Äëbased; flags outliers as noise Sensor spikes, route clusters, spatial hot‚Äëspots
Show complex data on 2D PCA / UMAP / t‚ÄëSNE Dimensionality reduction for visualization Ticket embeddings, well‚Äëlog vectors, genome data
Early warnings Isolation Forest / One‚ÄëClass SVM / z‚Äëscore Outlier detection w/out labeled failures Equip. faults, fraud spikes, traffic anomalies
Readiness

Data prerequisites before you cluster

Small checks that save big headaches

1
Right unit of analysis. Define one row = one entity/time window (e.g., branch‚Äëday).
2
Robust features. Handle missing values; scale numerics; one‚Äëhot encode categoricals; avoid obvious leakage from the future.
3
Manage dimensionality. Too many sparse columns ‚áí use PCA/UMAP or drop weak features first.
4
Sampling. If data are huge, start with a stratified sample; verify results on full data later.
5
Operational labels (optional). Decide how clusters/anomalies will be named and consumed by downstream teams.
Validation

How to evaluate without labels

Internal metrics + domain checks

Internal metrics

  • Silhouette ‚Üë, Calinski‚ÄìHarabasz ‚Üë, Davies‚ÄìBouldin ‚Üì
  • Stability under re‚Äëruns/bootstraps
  • Cluster size balance (avoid tiny shards unless they‚Äôre meaningful)

External sanity checks

  • Business separability (KPIs differ across clusters?)
  • Temporal consistency (do segments persist week to week?)
  • Explainability (top features that define each cluster)

Human‚Äëin‚Äëthe‚Äëloop

  • Let SMEs rename/merge/split clusters
  • Promote stable clusters to ‚Äúsegments‚Äù and track as metadata
Watch‚Äëouts

Common pitfalls & anti‚Äëpatterns

Avoid misleading segments and brittle setups

  • Confusing noise for insight. Very small clusters may be data errors or rare events.
  • Unscaled features. K‚ÄëMeans is distance‚Äëbased; always scale or results skew toward large‚Äëmagnitude variables.
  • Too many weak features. High‚Äëdimensional noise kills separation ‚Äî prune or compress first.
  • Static snapshots only. For operations data, use rolling windows; cluster drift over time is expected.
  • Acting without names. Assign clear labels (‚ÄúHigh‚Äëfootfall weekdays‚Äù, ‚ÄúWeekend‚Äëpromo responders‚Äù) so teams can use them.
Examples

Practical scenarios

Where this belongs in your pipeline

Bank operations

Cluster branch‚Äëdays by load; feed staffing and opening‚Äëhours policies; flag anomalies for incident review.

Geothermal / UTES

Cluster wells by thermal/pressure behavior; detect drift; create features for performance prediction.

E‚Äëcommerce

Segment buyers by journey; build different recommendations; monitor outlier carts for fraud signals.

HR & attendance

Group teams by absence patterns; forecast risk of under‚Äëstaffing; investigate unusual check‚Äëin/out sequences.

Prompts

Useful prompts to accelerate work

Copy‚Äìpaste, then refine with your column names

  • Feature ideas: ‚ÄúGiven columns , propose 15 clustering features (lags, ratios, seasonality, binary flags) and justify each.‚Äù
  • Method choice: ‚ÄúMy data have mixed types and outliers. Compare K‚ÄëMeans, GMM, and DBSCAN for this case and suggest defaults.‚Äù
  • Stability check: ‚ÄúGenerate a bootstrap plan to test cluster stability and report variation in Silhouette and cluster counts.‚Äù
  • Naming: ‚ÄúSuggest descriptive names for these clusters given their top features and KPI means.‚Äù

Random‚ÄëForest N‚ÄëDay Forecast ‚Äî Download & Run in GitHub Codespaces

Grab the ready‚Äëmade app, update two paths for Linux (Codespaces), and forecast your next N days.

The script rf_forecast_app.py is a stable Streamlit app that learns from a daily time series (e.g., total_visit) and predicts the next N days. It keeps state, engineers safe features (calendar cycles, lags, rolling means), evaluates on a recent test window, and exports CSVs.

Goal Simple language: ‚ÄúLoad a CSV with a date and a number per day, train a Random Forest, and predict the next N days without breaking on reruns.‚Äù

What it does

Exactly what this script is aiming to do

Tips

Common quick fixes

Solutions to typical hiccups

content.body_md:
Module ‚Ä¢ Supervised Machine Learning

What Supervised ML Is Good For ‚Äî Data & Problem Types

Simple, end‚Äëto‚Äëend guidance on when and how to use supervised learning.

Supervised machine learning learns a mapping from inputs (features) to a known target (label). You provide past examples: ‚Äúfeatures ‚Üí correct answer‚Äù. The model fits that relationship and predicts the answer for new, unseen cases.

Typical tasks are summarized by these labels: Regression (predict a number), Classification (pick a class), Multi‚Äëlabel (multiple classes at once), Ranking (order items), Forecasting (predict future numeric values).

Data

What kinds of data work well?

Structured tables, time series, text, images/audio, and mixed modalities.

Structured / Tabular

  • Columns like age, city, price, channel, etc.
  • Great for business KPIs, risk scoring, churn, credit, QA.
  • Strong baselines: Logistic/Linear models, Random Forest, XGBoost/GBMs, CatBoost.

Time Series

  • Timestamped signals (daily sales, sensor readings).
  • Forecasting (next N steps), anomaly detection (often hybrid).
  • Approaches: Feature‚Äëengineered regressors, GBMs, RF; or specialized models.

Text

  • Emails, tickets, reviews, documents.
  • Tasks: sentiment, topic, intent, entity extraction (NER), routing.
  • Approaches: classic TF‚ÄëIDF + linear, or transformers/LLM embeddings + classifier.

Images & Audio

  • Quality inspection, medical imaging, object detection, speech tags.
  • Approaches: CNNs/ViTs for images; spectrogram + CNNs or audio transformers.

Mixed / Multimodal

  • Combine text + tabular + images (e.g., e‚Äëcommerce product risk).
  • Stack or fuse embeddings with tabular features + GBM/NN classifier.
Cheat sheet

Match problem ‚Üí labels ‚Üí metrics ‚Üí starter models

Quick mapping you can apply directly.

Problem shape Label type Example Good metrics Starter models
Predict a number Regression Daily customers, revenue, energy use MAE, RMSE, MAPE, R¬≤ LinearReg, GBM (XGBoost/LightGBM/CatBoost), RF
Choose a class Classification (binary/multiclass) Approve/deny, defect type, lead quality Accuracy, F1, ROC‚ÄëAUC, PR‚ÄëAUC LogisticReg, GBM, RF, SVM
Multiple tags per item Multi‚Äëlabel Ticket topics, product attributes Micro/Macro‚ÄëF1, subset accuracy One‚Äëvs‚Äërest linear/GBM; NN for text

Fit assessment

When supervised ML is a good idea ‚Äî and when it isn‚Äôt

Use this quick checklist before you invest time.

Good fit ‚úÖ

  • You have labeled data (historical truth: ‚Äúwhat happened‚Äù).
  • Labels are consistent and meaningful for decisions.
  • Inputs are available at prediction time (no leakage from the future).
  • Clear business action follows a prediction (approve, route, staff).
  • Performance can be measured with a specific metric.

Not a great fit ‚ùå

  • No reliable labels (consider unsupervised or labeling first).
  • Labels change meaning frequently (concept drift) with no retraining plan.
  • Sample size is tiny for the task complexity (high risk of overfitting).
  • Data you‚Äôd need is not available at decision time.
  • Prediction doesn‚Äôt drive any decision (no ROI).

Practice

Data quality, metrics, and deployment guardrails

Avoid common pitfalls that sink projects.

Labels & Splits

  • Ensure labels are correct; reduce noise (clear definitions).
  • Use time‚Äëbased splits for time series; avoid leakage.
  • Track class imbalance; use stratified splits & proper metrics (PR‚ÄëAUC, F1).

Metrics & Thresholds

  • Pick a metric that matches the decision (F1 vs ROC‚ÄëAUC, MAE vs MAPE).
  • Calibrate probability thresholds for business constraints (precision/recall trade‚Äëoff).

Model Choice

Deployment & Monitoring

  • Batch (nightly) vs real‚Äëtime (API) depending on latency needs.
